Salmasius was the first to detect an important error in the different editions of Pliny, sud to restore a passage, according to his judgment, to the original intention of the author ⁴.

The passage ³, “Milton vocant Groeci minium, quidam cinna- bari,” “the Greeks call minium miltos, some cinnabar,” has been restored by him to “(llubicam) milton vocant Graeci, minium que cinnabari;¹’ a statement which would be certainly correct, and therefore fairly attributable to Pliny, many of whose “arma'' have been more the mistakes of his cominentators than his own.
